newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE sugar extends gains but pressure cited.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE sugar extends gains but pressure cited.

text.p: LIFFE white sugar futures mustered further gains on nearby short-covering on Friday afternoon but no news was cited.
Traders said the volume on nearbys was encouraging and buyers, although now apparently backing off, could to be tempted again.
But the outlook depended on the level of physical offtake which is nothing more than a just routine schedule of purchases at present.

"Perhaps for the time being the market may be near the lows but I would imagine over the course of next week if there is no further offtake the market would start its way back down again," said one trader.
At 1630 GMT, the spot December contract stood just off the day's high at $307.10 a tonne, up $1.40, while the second-month March traded $1.00 higher at $306.20 after a peak of $306.90.
Chart resistance is expected to show up around $308.00-309.00, according to analysts.

"The RSI is currently attempting to break out of oversold levels and this could help push prices higher," said trade house Sucden in a comment on March sugar. On December, it saw resistance at $307.50.
Traders said good crop reports from Europe added to overall jitters.
"Eventually the market will return and start easing back off again," said one.
Paris March sugar traded $1.20 up on the day at $306.20 a tonne.
